Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.client.view.gui

Class GameSceneModel

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP14.client.view.gui.GameSceneModel
public class GameSceneModel
extends java.lang.Object
This class manages the actors in a 3D context, bridging the viewable content with the abstract data from the server, through a series of utility methods.

    • getRoot

      public javafx.scene.Group getRoot()

    • setupScenery

      public void setupScenery()
      Init the scenery (sea, board, cliff, all the cosmetic stuff).

    • addActor

      public void addActor​(java.lang.String id, java.lang.String meshUrl, java.lang.String textureUrl, javafx.geometry.Point3D position, double scale)
      Add an actor to the scene
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the actor
      meshUrl - an absolute path relative to the resource folder where the OBJ model resides.
      textureUrl - an absolute path relative to the resource folder where the PNG texture resides.
      position - the position of the actor
      scale - the scale of the actor

    • getActorById

      public javafx.scene.Node getActorById​(java.lang.String id)
      Get an actor (Node) from the actors data structure
      Parameters:
      id - the key of that actor
      Returns:
      the Node of that actor

    • getWorkerActorId

      public static java.lang.String getWorkerActorId​(int player, int workerId)
      Get a worker actor id.
      Parameters:
      player - the worker's player number
      workerId - the worker's number
      Returns:
      a key (String) representing that worker

    • addWorker

      public void addWorker​(Point point, int workerId, int playerId)
      Add a worker to the board.
      Parameters:
      point - a model coordinate
      workerId - the worker id number
      playerId - the player id number

    • removeWorker

      public void removeWorker​(int workerId, int playerId)
      Remove a worker from the game.
      Parameters:
      workerId - the worker id number
      playerId - the player id number

    • getWorker

      public javafx.scene.Node getWorker​(int player, int worker)
      Get a worker by passing the player it belongs to and the id of the worker.
      Parameters:
      player - the player number
      worker - the worker number
      Returns:
      that worker's node reference

    • getAllWorkers

      public java.util.List<javafx.scene.Node> getAllWorkers()
      Return a collection of nodes representing all the workers in the game.
      Returns:
      a collection of nodes

    • getAllPlayerWorkers

      public java.util.List<Point> getAllPlayerWorkers​(int playerId)
      Return an ordered list of points representing all the workers of a certain player.
      Parameters:
      playerId - the id of the player
      Returns:
      a list of points

    • getAllBlocks

      public java.util.List<javafx.scene.Node> getAllBlocks()
      Return a list of nodes representing all the building components in the game.
      Returns:
      a collection of nodes

    • hideBlock

      public void hideBlock​(javafx.scene.Node block)
      Hide the block passed as a parameter with a cool animation. Unsafe: due to performance reasons, we don't check if we're resizing an actual block or another node. Nothing bad should happen, except a (possible) visual glitch.
      Parameters:
      block - the block to hide

    • showBlock

      public void showBlock​(javafx.scene.Node block)
      Show the block passed as a parameter with a cool animation. Unsafe: same reason as hideBlock(Node)
      Parameters:
      block - the block to show

    • moveWorker

      public void moveWorker​(int playerNumber, int workerNumber, Point position, java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch latch)
      Move a worker with a cool animation.
      Parameters:
      playerNumber - the number of the worker's player (0, 1, 2)
      workerNumber - the number of the worker (0 or 1)
      position - the target position
      latch - the CountDownLatch reference to prevent unwanted behaviour

    • moveWorkerNode

      private void moveWorkerNode​(Point position, javafx.scene.Node worker, java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch latch)
      Move a worker to a target position with a cool animation.
      Parameters:
      position - the target position
      latch - latch to avoid async issues
      worker - the worker to move

    • getTowerHeight

      private int getTowerHeight​(Point position)
      Get a tower height in model "numbers".
      Parameters:
      position - the tower position in model coordinates
      Returns:
      the height of the tower

    • getWorkerHeight

      private double getWorkerHeight​(Point workerPos)
      Get a preset coordinate for a worker height
      Parameters:
      workerPos - a model coordinate for the worker
      Returns:
      the world Y coordinate for that worker

      private double getNewTowerHeight​(Point towerPos)
      Get a preset coordinate for a tower height
      Parameters:
      towerPos - a model coordinate for the tower
      Returns:
      the world Y coordinate for that tower

      Get the block ID string.
      Parameters:
      position - of the block
      height - of the block
      Returns:
      the unique block label

    • addToActorsAndRegister

      private void addToActorsAndRegister​(java.lang.String id, javafx.scene.Node node)
      Keep track of a node by binding it with an ID
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the node
      node - the node

    • incrementCell

      public void incrementCell​(Point position)
      Add a tower block on a tower.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the tower.

    • updateWorkers

      private void updateWorkers()
      Updates the worker position, to prevent them to glitching into towers. It should get called when a cell is updated.

    • updateSelectables

      private void updateSelectables()
      Updates the selectable position, to prevent them to glitching into towers. It should get called when a cell is updated.

    • putDome

      public void putDome​(Point position)
      Put a dome on the cell, "filling" the tower (setting it to height 3). WARN: Chronus + Atlas (might) cause graphic glitches.
      Parameters:
      position - the model position of the dome

    • setTower

      private void setTower​(Point position, int height)
      Build a tower in the specified model position at the specified height.
      Parameters:
      position - the model position of the tower
      height - the height of the tower

    • getWorkerPositions

      public java.util.List<Point> getWorkerPositions()

    • addSelectable

      public void addSelectable​(int index, Point targetPos)
      Creates a rect at target position
      Parameters:
      index - index of the selectable
      targetPos - where to spawn the rect

    • addAllSelectables

      public void addAllSelectables​(java.util.List<Point> positions)
      Render a list of points (choices) as selectables.
      Parameters:
      positions - a list of points

    • removeAllSelectables

      public void removeAllSelectables()
      Remove all rendered selectables from the scene.

    • moveSelectableNode

      private void moveSelectableNode​(Point p, javafx.scene.Node n)
      Move a selectable node adjusting its height
      Parameters:
      p - target position
      n - the node of the selectable

    • getSelectableHeight

      private double getSelectableHeight​(Point towerPos)
      Get a preset coordinate for a selectable height
      Parameters:
      towerPos - a model coordinate for the selectable
      Returns:
      the world Y coordinate for that selectable

      Returns:

    • getSceneCoordinates

      public static javafx.geometry.Point3D getSceneCoordinates​(Point v)
      Get world coordinates from Point (2D).
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the point in world coordinates

    • getSceneWorkerCoordinates

      public javafx.geometry.Point3D getSceneWorkerCoordinates​(Point point)
      Get the coordinates to place a worker from a Point (2D).
      Parameters:
      point - the point from the model
      Returns:
      new worker coordinates

    • getSceneTowerCoordinates

      public javafx.geometry.Point3D getSceneTowerCoordinates​(Point point)
      Get the coordinates to place a tower block from a Point (2D). The returned coordinates contain the updated Y axis, to place the block of the tower at the correct height.
      Parameters:
      point - the point from the model
      Returns:
      new tower block coordinates

    • getSceneSelectableCoordinates

      public javafx.geometry.Point3D getSceneSelectableCoordinates​(Point point)
      Get the coordinates to place a worker from a Point (2D).
      Parameters:
      point - the point from the model
      Returns:
      new worker coordinates

    • getSceneCoordinates

      public static javafx.geometry.Point3D getSceneCoordinates​(javafx.scene.Node n)
      Get the coordinates of a generic Node with a Point3D.
      Parameters:
      n - the node
      Returns:
      a Point3D of the coordinates of the node n
